document_title: Acute prostatitis: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Acute prostatitis is a condition in which the gland becomes inflamed and suddenly swollen, causing pain, painful urination, frequent urination, difficulty urinating, painful ejaculation, and possibly cloudy fluid or pus in the urethra. In most of these cases, the cause usually comes from a type of bacteria that causes urinary tract infections or sexually transmitted diseases. (first)
Specifically, the prostate is a small, walnut-shaped organ that hugs the neck of the male bladder. This gland has the function of secreting fluid to transport sperm during ejaculation. When the prostate is inflamed, the process does not function normally, the patient will encounter many serious problems related to sexual function, urination...
subsection_title: viem tuyen tien liet cap tinh.json. What is acute prostatitis?
